alert.note: Alert for Brown (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 17 at 1:43PM MDT until further notice by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Aberdeen SD has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in South Dakota...North Dakota... Maple River Near Frederick affecting Dickey and Brown Counties. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Maple River Near Frederick. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.5 feet, The bridge 2 miles north of the gage is overtopped * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:16 PM CDT Monday the stage was 10.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:16 PM CDT Monday was 10.3 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued Tuesday evening by 1045 PM CDT.
